text: The press freedom campaign has scored a win after Labor’s shadow attorney-general told Sky News journalists doing their job should be exempt from prosecution under national security laws. In a major shift, Mark Dreyfus said such legislative changes would be “appropriate”. “The government ought to be bringing legislation into the parliament to do this. Clearly this government hasn’t understood the discretions that are there,” he said. “It’s not a blanket exemption. It’s recognising the vital role that splayed by journalists in our democracy.” Image: News Corp Australia
